001package imagingbook.common.geometry.delaunay.chew;
002

010 *******************************************************************************/
011
012import java.util.Arrays;
013import java.util.Collection;
014import java.util.Iterator;
015import java.util.NoSuchElementException;
016
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
018import imagingbook.common.geometry.delaunay.Triangle;
019
020
021/**
022 * A Triangle is an immutable Set of exactly three Pnts.
023 *
024 * All Set operations are available. Individual vertices can be accessed via
025 * iterator() and also via triangle.get(index).
026 *
027 * Note that, even if two triangles have the same vertex set, they are
028 * *different* triangles. Methods equals() and hashCode() are consistent with
029 * this rule.
030 *
031 * @author Paul Chew
032 *
033 * Created December 2007. Replaced general simplices with geometric triangle.
034 *
035 * Adapted by W. Burger (2019)
036 * @version 2020-01-01
037 */
038public class Triangle2D extends ArraySet<Pnt> implements Triangle {
039
040    private int idNumber;                   // The id number
041    private Pnt circumcenter = null;        // The triangle's circumcenter
042
043    private static int idGenerator = 0;     // Used to create id numbers
044    public static boolean moreInfo = true; // True iff more info in toString
045
046    /**
047     * @param vertices the vertices of the Triangle.
048     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if there are not three distinct vertices
049     */
050    public Triangle2D (Pnt... vertices) {
051        this(Arrays.asList(vertices));
052    }
053
054    /**
055     * @param collection a Collection holding the Simplex vertices
056     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if there are not three distinct vertices
057     */
058    public Triangle2D (Collection<? extends Pnt> collection) {
059        super(collection);
060        idNumber = idGenerator++;
061        if (this.size() != 3)
062            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Triangle must have 3 vertices");
063    }
064    
065        public Triangle2D(Pnt2d[] points) {
066                this(new Pnt(points[0]), new Pnt(points[1]), new Pnt(points[2]));
067        }
068    
069    // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
070
071    @Override
072    public String toString () {
073        if (!moreInfo) return "Triangle" + idNumber;
074        return "Triangle" + idNumber + super.toString();
075    }
076
077    /**
078     * Get arbitrary vertex of this triangle, but not any of the bad vertices.
079     * @param badVertices one or more bad vertices
080     * @return a vertex of this triangle, but not one of the bad vertices
081     * @throws NoSuchElementException if no vertex found
082     */
083    public Pnt getVertexButNot (Pnt... badVertices) {
084        Collection<Pnt> bad = Arrays.asList(badVertices);
085        for (Pnt v: this) if (!bad.contains(v)) return v;
086        throw new NoSuchElementException("No vertex found");
087    }
088
089    /**
090     * True iff triangles are neighbors. Two triangles are neighbors if they
091     * share a facet.
092     * @param triangle the other Triangle
093     * @return true iff this Triangle is a neighbor of triangle
094     */
095    public boolean isNeighbor (Triangle2D triangle) {
096        int count = 0;
097        for (Pnt vertex: this)
098            if (!triangle.contains(vertex)) count++;
099        return count == 1;
100    }
101
102    /**
103     * Report the facet opposite vertex.
104     * @param vertex a vertex of this Triangle
105     * @return the facet opposite vertex
106     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the vertex is not in triangle
107     */
108    public ArraySet<Pnt> facetOpposite (Pnt vertex) {
109        ArraySet<Pnt> facet = new ArraySet<Pnt>(this);
110        if (!facet.remove(vertex))
111            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Vertex not in triangle");
112        return facet;
113    }
114
115    /**
116     * @return the triangle's circumcenter
117     */
118    public Pnt getCircumcenter () {
119        if (circumcenter == null)
120            circumcenter = Pnt.circumcenter(this.toArray(new Pnt[0]));
121        return circumcenter;
122    }
123
124    /* The following two methods ensure that a Triangle is immutable */
125
126    @Override
127    public boolean add (Pnt vertex) {
128        throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
129    }
130
131    @Override
132    public Iterator<Pnt> iterator () {
133        return new Iterator<Pnt>() {
134            private Iterator<Pnt> it = Triangle2D.super.iterator();
135            public boolean hasNext() {return it.hasNext();}
136            public Pnt next() {return it.next();}
137            public void remove() {throw new UnsupportedOperationException();}
138        };
139    }
140
141    /* The following two methods ensure that all triangles are different. */
142
143    @Override
144    public int hashCode () {
145        return (int)(idNumber^(idNumber>>>32));
146    }
147
148    @Override
149    public boolean equals (Object o) {
150        return (this == o);
151    }
152
153    // method required by {@link Triangle} interface:
154    
155        @Override
156        public Pnt2d[] getPoints() {
157                return this.toArray(new Pnt2d[0]);
158        }
159
160}
